data.title: Game controller recognized but not operational
data.body: Forum report: i have figured out that by using an if statement with input.numJoysticks and setting an boolean to true if numJoysticks is greater or equal to 1 then it Works as expected (it recognizes my wired Xbox 360 controller!) but i cannot get any kind of signal from the controller to the game (or is it vice-versa?) even though i can receive a 1 from the if statement.... i know this sounds confusing but i do hope it is at least a Little understandable, i basically am trying to say that i can get my controller to be recognized as an compatible controller but i can do nothing with it! i don't know if it is something that needs to be implemented first or if it should already be there but i cannot find it

data.title: Fix the ATOMIC_BUILD_2D cmake flag to default off.  Also, look into why sometimes requires a second cmake invocation to build
Linux Build
Compiling on Linux
data.body:
I currently try to compile the source on linux (Mint 17/Ubuntu 14.10) and I am documenting what is needed to compile on linux.

As far I have done following changes(and in this order) to succesfully build:
- _libCpuId_ `typedef redefinition with different types ('long' vs 'long long')`
  I removed their definition(libcpuid_types.h) of int64_t as sys/types.h already has this type. 
- _TurboBadger_ `use of undeclared identifier 'nullptr'`
  Definitely a missing -std=c++11. Added in the generated flags.make
- _Atomic/Graphics/_ `'d3d9.h' file not found`
  I do not know why it was choosen to work on DirectX so I added a -DATOMIC_OPENGL in the corresponding flags.make.
- _Atomic/Environment/ProcSky.cpp_ `unknown type name 'uint8_t'`
  I added the commented lines

```
#if defined(_MSC_VER)
#include "stdint.h"
// #else
// #include <stdint.h>
#endif
```
- _Several kNet header_ `error: unknown type name 'sockaddr_in'`
  Add some points the `#if defined(KNET_UNIX)` seemed not the be taken although in the flags.make it is defined. So I changed to no condition.
- _JSBind/cplusplus_ `no template named 'unordered_map' in namespace 'std'; did you mean 'std::tr1::unordered_map'?` and `'auto' type specifier is a C++11 extension`
  Added a missing -std=c++11 to the flags.make

But now I stuck at the following point: Linking CXX executable JSBind
It lacks on several linkings against the following libraries: 
- GL
- GLEW
- DL
- pthread
- rt

I tried to add these as CXX_FLAGS but it did not change anything. Same undefined reference errors on gl_*, glew_*, sem_*, pthread_*, dl_*

Can anyone help me to fix these linkings?

FYI: I am not used to configure cmake makefiles so I do not know whether I change things at the right point. C(++) compiler is clang(++).

data.title: HTML5 export and IE11
data.body:
There is no sound (probably because of ogg and ie11 needs m4a ?)
The game only can be played once (after that the game froze).I received this error when I was playing it   "too many setjmps in a function call, build with a higher value for MAX_SETJMPS"

 If you try to refresh the page. I keep getting "Out of memory" at the developer console.

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/65841566/Space/AtomicPlayer.html

data.title: Make windows content able to be dockable and moveable
data.body: I think it is important to be able to dock and maybe even move the window to second monitor to improve visibility and productivity.

data.title: Add clear recent project list button
data.body:
Sometimes I open too many new projects and etc. I want to be able to start from fresh.
Also the recent project list panel can't be resize. Maybe add that too ?

data.title: Add Social support
data.body:
Please add social support like

-Facebook
-Google+
-Twitter

So that we can use like "share" button or post highscore at the user wall or post something like "Hey I got a cool game you can download it at "url ........" "

Could improve our apps or games visibility

Please add

-leaderboards

I think this would be vital to make more people downloads and play the games.

data.title: Add performance debugging or performance monitoring panel
data.body:
Maybe add another button "debug" besides the "play" button. When clicked on "debug" button. A panel or something will show or popup and it will display:

1)current fps
2)memory usage
3)cpu usage
4)total object created and active
5)maybe add "add watch" to variable or object so that we can monitor it more thoroughly
6)more info that can help to detect problem and maybe improve performance

data.title: Add support for spriter new scon format
data.body:
Currently only support scml file. I've read from lucid at brashmonkey that scon is faster than xml. I'm not sure engine capability, which is actually faster ? xml or json ?

https://github.com/Acemobe/SpriterAS3Anim/blob/master/lib/com/acemobe/spriter/Spriter.as

data.title: Add "save as" features in the editor
data.body:
I think this would be easier to duplicate file.

You can save as new project if you want to make major changes and want to test it first without overwrite original project.

data.title: Add support to find text in project
data.body: Add find text features(find in current document or in all files). When found will list down all the related findings and when double clicked it will go to that file.

data.title: Remove unnecessary null pointer checks
data.body:
[An extra null pointer check is not needed in functions](https://isocpp.org/wiki/faq/freestore-mgmt#delete-handles-null) like the following.
- [JSASTFunctionExpression](https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/b8f839bcf06af8c25a2336fabc472003aa68b899/Source/AtomicEditor/Source/Javascript/JSAST.cpp#L609)
- [JSASTProperty](https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/b8f839bcf06af8c25a2336fabc472003aa68b899/Source/AtomicEditor/Source/Javascript/JSAST.h#L279)
- [safe_delete](https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/f7e19e317343dcccc0cf7c45f7abeabf05ff65e2/Source/ThirdParty/TurboBadger/tb_str.cpp#L16)

data.title: Large World Support and supplemental tools
data.body:
This feature request is to get large world support for the atomic game engine.

That said level streaming or whatever method is chosen should work in both Multiplayer and singleplayer.

Supplemental tools - 

Procedural Foliage Placement Tool - http://www.twitch.tv/unrealengine/b/640974337 (Starts at 9:00)

Spline tool for roads and rivers - https://vimeo.com/4304245
